definition: to release/to set free/to liberate (a prisoner)/to discharge
to explain/to release/Buddha (abbr. for 釋迦牟尼|释迦牟尼[Shi4 jia1 mou2 ni2])/Buddhism
to put/to place/to release/to free/to let go/to let out/to set off (fireworks)

sentences.english: Then, from Tuesday afternoon through Thursday, the stars send intense and beautiful energy your way.
sentences.chinese: 從週二下午到週四，巨蟹宮將會釋放強勁的能量。

sentences.english: OBJECTIVE To prepare praziquantel implants and investigate the in vitro drug release.
sentences.chinese: 目的製備胸腺五肽微球並對其體外釋放進行考察。

sentences.english: This complex emits low pollution levels and employs many workers.
sentences.chinese: 聯合企業釋放低污染並且僱用很多工人。

sentences.english: R15 Contact with water liberates extremely flammable gases.
sentences.chinese: 遇水釋放極易燃燒的氣體。

sentences.english: The gall bladder stores and discharges the bile, which helps to break down fats into minute droplets.
sentences.chinese: 膽囊儲存和釋放膽汁，協助脂肪分解爲微小的顆粒。

sentences.english: According to the act of grace many prisoners will be set free.
sentences.chinese: 按照大赦令，很多囚犯獲得釋放。

sentences.english: Sugar, however, blocked the release of orexin.
sentences.chinese: 糖類則會阻礙促食素的釋放。

sentences.english: The release rate of the prepared cream base was investigated by diffusion method.
sentences.chinese: 採用擴散法考察所制乳膏釋放度。

sentences.english: But due to lack of evidence, the court couldn't pass a sentence and released Chu temporarily.
sentences.chinese: 因無確鑿證據，知府不敢草率判決，暫將朱爾旦釋放。

sentences.english: The underlying strength of the U. S. economy is gradually re-asserting itself.
sentences.chinese: 美國經濟的內在活力又一次逐漸釋放出來了。

sentences.english: Fosfomycin also belong to middle type.
sentences.chinese: 此外，磷黴素也具有中等釋放率。

sentences.english: Ammonia gas released byfertilizefertilized cropland is a cause of air pollution.
sentences.chinese: 被施過肥的農田釋放的氨氣是空氣污染的原因之一。

sentences.english: Swimming A Fort Lauderdale swimmer releases the air in his lungs underwater.
sentences.chinese: 勞德戴爾堡壘游泳者在水下面釋放他肺中的空氣。

sentences.english: The lock release occurs even if the return was caused by an uncaught exception.
sentences.chinese: 即使是未捕獲的異常造成了返回，也會發生鎖的釋放。

sentences.english: Gas regulation is by both carbon sequestration and oxygen supply.
sentences.chinese: 大氣調節包括碳固定和氧氣釋放。

sentences.english: This is because the palladium nanoparticles continued to release trapped electrons.
sentences.chinese: 這是因爲鈀納米顆粒在不斷地釋放捕獲的電子。

definition: to be capable of/to be able to/can
to yield/to permit/to let sb do sth/to have sb do sth/to make sb (feel sad etc)/by (indicates the agent in a passive clause, like 被[bei4])
to pass through/to penetrate/by means of/via
by means of/through/via/to pass through/to get through/to adopt/to pass (a bill or inspection etc)/to switch over
immediately/at once/at that moment/at the moment
